If you do come here, try and sit outside when the weather is good.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed O'nieals yet! I have never been disappointed dining here. This is a great spot for Brunch or dinner. The burgers are incredible (pancho villa & the wall streeter are my fav).  Last night I tried the fettuccine alberto for the first time and thought it was quite good. Even made for great left overs for my lunch today. Love when it's nice enough to sit outside especially in the evening when the trees are lit up with the white Christmas lights around the patio.  Short and sweet you want to eat here.
Great steak, 14 oz, nice spinach, chicken great as well, try French onion soup nice quaint dining area in rear

Someone from the restaurant recently reached out and was very gracious. Speaks highly of him and of the staff. Very classy. Hated to speak ill of them, even if temporarily, but the best relationships are based upon honesty. That's how serious I take my burgers and otherwise upscale pub food.

After reading some great reviews, I thought I'd come try a burger. The food took a while to come out, and the waiters forgot to bring out the bread. the fries were pretty good, but the Cajun burger wasn't anything special. It really lacked flavor. Cute and friendly environment nonetheless.

A real neighborhood joint. Had dinner on a recent crowded Friday and the cozy back room still felt like going to a friend's house. Everyone was super-nice, from the hostess to the waitress to the busboy. Warm bread with olive oil and a little butter and shredded cheese to nibble on while you wait for your meal is a nice lagniappe, and extra points for bringing some no matter what you order. Food was cooked exactly as we requested, and even though the place was full we were never rushed and had a perfectly paced meal. Couldn't ask for more.

Great restaurant/bar.  Food and service was great. Every time I eat there I'm never disappointed with the dish I order. Accordingly to my dad who has eaten tons of burgers and fries in his life Oneils burgers are amazing, fries are out of this world to him. I like going on Wednesdays for wine down Wednesday night, $5 glass of wine, can't beat that.

I love spicy food, so the buffalo wings were a nice start to the meal. Got the hottest (buffalo) and was the right heat level to share, though I have a high tolerance and didn't find them to be hot.Had the Cajun burger cooked medium. Really juicy with nice flavor and great toppings. Blew away the other burgers and wings I've had in Hoboken yet.

It's a quite nice place, if you are looking for a place to go out on a date, this one could be a good option.. It's pretty cozy, so perhaps you wanna hold someone once you are here thou! And they know how to properly serve a Guinness, you don't know how hard is to get a good Guinness well poured! Bartenders and waiters were really kind and polite. So, let's talk about food It was well prepared and good flavors.. If you are looking for fancy and well designed dishes, you should keep looking around because this place is more traditional! Love it!

I guess it's good that not many people know about this place.  The food is very good and the beer selection is excellent.  Best of all, it's about 3 blocks from my place.The burger may be one of the best in Hoboken.  It comes with different toppings (fried egg!) and a heap of fries.  I know my burgers, and I highly recommend the burger here.The service was really good and it didn't take long for us to be seated (we came on a busy night).  The only cons I can speak of are the following: nachos were average and the dining room is very small, making it hard to get a seat.  Other than that, Onieals is awesome.

I love Onieals! My beloved brunch companion is pretty picky with her food orders (basically, she creates her own meals) and they never have issues with her selection and the cooks always get it right.Not sure if it's only a night-time thing, but when did they get rid of the white paper and crayons on every table? I love to doodle. Nothing made me happier - NOTHING - than when I could color all over the table whilst waiting for my food.Yes, I am a grown child.Anyway, this doesn't affect the quality of the food. I've been here on a date and I've been here with my parents. Good atmosphere for all situations. The bar area in the front can get loud, but the dining section in the back is quiet and intimate.Four stars!
Tried the burgers because of all of the positive reviews. They were so greasy we couldn't even finish them. Would not return.

Oniels is a solid three stars without a doubt. We don't live far from here and have been a dozen times or so. Mostly for dinner or lunch but a couple times for brunch. The food is decent here, the burgers are pretty great and the fries are good. Their other sandwiches are kind of hit or miss. I've had a variety, but if you eat here choose any of the burgers if going for a sandwich.Brunch was kind of meh nothing to write home about, I'd rather go to Anthony Davids, Elysian Cafe or La Isla. But it's close and has outdoor seating.Dinner service again is hit or miss. Last time we went, on a Monday evening. They wouldn't sit me until my fiance arrived, the place was literally empty in the back room and unless they expected a hoard of two tops to walk in in the next 10 minutes, customer service wise I should have grabbed a table. Especially while the three hosts sat there texting. Fine, you have policies, I get it. This last time we went because it was close and we didn't want to make a night of going out to eat. We were there for an hour and a half and we weren't drinking. The ticket time for a buffalo chicken salad and a turkey sandwich was over 40 minutes. We actually were about to leave when the food finally came. Our waitress never apologized, never explained what was going on and never checked in. I could tell she knew it was taking too long but she avoided it. I didn't want free food but an apology for taking 40 minutes would have been nice. It was obvious my fiance's sandwich had died under the heat lamp the fries were hard as rocks and the sandwich was too. My salad was just ok as well, not worth waiting for 40 minutes.They never really have specials to speak of unless you sit at the bar, which is tiny about 10 stools. Most places will extend happy hour to other seats especially outdoor seating, but they don't.The outdoor seating is pleasant right next to church square. It's worth a try and the occasional stop in for a pretty good burger and fries. But a lot of times it takes forever service wise and that drives me nuts.

From the outside it's nothing to look at, but this Hoboken spot is definitely worth checking out.  As you walk in to Onieals (a funny way to spell it if you ask me-I couldn't look it up at first because I was using the traditional spelling) you'll see what amounts to an old style drinking bar with lots of wood and charm.  There are bar tables in the front and regular dining tables in the rear.  You might think the food is so so, but it is not.The food is very good! With a varied burger and sandwich selection, a nice assortment of salads and some good ole standard appetizers.  There's a brunch menu as well as a regular lunch/dinner menu.  I had the chicken pesto pita with hummus and fried mozzarella as an appetizer, and a bloody mary.  My dish was on the small size but by no means was the taste small; it was delicious!  The burgers looked great and I was told by my family that they were equally big on taste.  A must see place if you ever go to Hoboken.

great place all around. HIGHLY recommend the mac and cheese it really might be the best I've ever had I might go over in a little bit and get it again. steak is awesome wings too. chicken fingers are kinda a miss (I expect them to be awesome everywhere and these are just blah) but everythig else I've ever had here is amazing

I didn't care for the staff very much, on either of my two visits. However, the food is amazing!! I've gone for both lunch and dinner. Their burgers are amazing.. the mac and cheese is pretty great, steaks.. cooked perfectly. Best fries and cocktails! Ill def be making this one of my hotspots.

I feel gastronomically violated...yet I blame myself for picking this place for dinner based on the 4 star Yelp reviews:(I should have noticed that all the good reviews here are for beer and burgers, but not for ANYTHING ELSE. I was unlucky enough to be one of the customers who got "something else." We dropped by because my husband was craving burgers, and were immediately seated. FOURTY FIVE minutes later, we were actually served food. How is that acceptable? We just got two entrees (one of which was a salad) and an app. The waitress was nice, but after coming in to check on us asking "how is everything," it got hard not to sarcastically reply, "you mean our water and table bread? it's phenomenal...."On to the food. Our mozzarella sticks which were served ON a plate of marinara sauce. I had never seen fried food served ON a bed of liquid sauce before. They usually come separate. Needless to say, after a few minutes, the batter was soggy from soaking in sauce for 10 minutes. But that didn't even matter, because the mozzarella itself tasted like FREEZER BURN. It was clearly frozen for way too long, and the after taste was disgusting. But, to avoid being a diva, we sucked it up and didn't say anything. Then, after another eternity, our food finally came. The burger was decent - no complaints there, but my salad was beyond disgusting. It was a densely packed bed of salad leaves with balsamic dressing the consistency of lard. I mean, it looked like jelly instead of creamy dressing. I really could have had a better experience eating Wendy's one dollar side salads. i ate one bite and just could not go on.Anyway, i guess you could argue that this is a bar, and you can't expect a good salad. To their credit, i did mention that the burger was decent. BUT, if you can't get fried cheese right, and your salad makes me gag, I think you need to re-assess the menu and stick to what you do best - burgers and fries - rather than put people through a painfully long wait time and gross appetizers for a thundering disappointment when the entree comes. People - come here for drinks and fries. BUT NOT FOR ANYTHING ELSE.
One of our favorite restaurants to eat and drink! We Prettymuch pay rent there because we go so often. Food is awesome, drink specials are great and service is very friendly

Listen - if you want a top two burger in town with a quality atmosphere, come to Onieal's. Great meat. Great roll. Great variety of burgers. Hand cut fries. Delicious. Fughedaboutit. Now, if you want to wait 45 minutes for your appetizer, and another 45 for that top two burger, and a waiter that doesn't care about you, come to Onieal's.  Some people don't mind waiting for food, some do. The choice is yours.
Great place and service.  Felt like a neighborhood joint with fantastic beverages and food.  Will be back!

Best burgers, nachos & BBQ sauce in Hoboken. Their servers are always great, cozy atmosphere and wine Wednesday is a blast. Sometimes their is a long wait for tables, particularly in the summer, but it's well worth it. One of the best in town!
No question, the best burger menu in Hoboken!Also a great bar staff, and solid beer list (including gluten free!).Try the Spivy Burger!

Went in to grab a quick dinner. The bar was really crowded and we couldn't see a hostess, but once you walk toward the back, the dining room was pretty empty and we were seated promptly. I had the Rotini Arrabiatta and my partner had the Shepard's pie. Both were great, though the Shepard's pie came with a lackluster bowl of spinach. I mean, it wasn't even seasoned, so why put it there? Overall, good experience. Nothing special. The live music was nice, but boy, were we glad not to have dined at the bar. It was so crowded and rowdy by the time we left that it kind of felt like restaurant had a split personality.

The restaurant has fairly good food at good prices for lunch. The issue is their restaurant seems somewhat small and cannot handle a surge of people. Today we had to wait an hour to get food after ordering but the restaurant generously comped our meal as a result.

So good, live around the corner and have brought 3 different set of visitors here because I know they will be more than satisfied. If I had one complaint it would be that it's too small! Great burgers!

Oneials is great! I've been here a half a dozen times, or more, typically to watch a game. Saturdays the crowd is an Ohio State contingency and if you're not wearing red the owner won't acknowledge you, but will shake the hands of all the OSU fans you're sitting with (awkward...). When you're not subjected to a meet and greet (or, rather, a meet and ignore) with the owner, the place is totally chill, plus the bartenders are particularly excellent.I recently hit up a Sunday Funday to watch an NFL game and the patrons were a lot more diverse and a little bit less hard core. Specials at game time are a breeze, typically $2 Miller Lite drafts and $8/$10 Wings/Burger with Fries + a beer of your choice special. Food is fresh and I'd love to hit up a dinner here at the dining room 'round back. Truly, most experiences here are a solid 4 stars, but I'd like to give 'em 3 due to the weird experience meeting (or being shunned by) the owner for wearing green instead of red. Hey Mr. Owner, at least I wasn't wearing blue and gold!!

I like this place because it is close to my apt and it has a great atmosphere. The service can be slow at times especially if you sit in the front. Today I ordered the French Onion Soup which I wasn't a fan of.  The cheese was burnt which ruined the soup for me. My friend ordered chicken parm and it was huge. My other friend ordered the "Wall Streeter" and she really enjoyed it. I should have ordered that, it looked amazing ! I Definitely would come back here for burgers and beers but not French Onion soup or Italian!

What is with the spelling??? They can fit in another vowel. Anyway- Best bar in Hoboken- I know that is not saying much- but if you happen to find yourself in the land of high fiving- crooked hat wearing - deuches- this is your spot. Service is excellent. Friendly. Swift. When you finish your drink, they ask if you want another one. I know that this is a simple concept, but a lot of places and bartenders seem to mess it up. Not at O'Neiaielll's. Haven't tried the food- but their ability to get a drink in my hand in a timely fashion has won me over. Bravo O'Nieal's... Bravo!!! (I'll overlook the spelling issue...  for now).
Love the food here! A lot of outdoor seating. At night they have all the big trees outside wrapped in christmas lights which makes for a very cool vibe. The service is great!

This place a really relaxing, intimate vibe.  I like that they practice full disclosure with the sign at the table saying the food will take 15-60 minutes and to be patient.  The peach sangria was delicious.  I tried the buffalo wings and the nachos both were delicious.  I was too stuffed to try the burger I ordered with a friend so Ill have to go back.

I love Onieals! I live right around the corner, so I've been here many times over the years. The service is always great and the food is awesome. I really like the French onion soup, and their penne vodka is surprisingly good. I recently tried their brunch for the first time and really liked it! I highly recommend Onieals. You won't be disappointed.

I got lunch at Onieal's today and sat outside. Service was pretty slow; I kept getting the idea they forgot about us because we were out of sight. Kind of a bummer. The food was average this time. The burger patty was good, but the roll was meh, and the fries were not hot. The veggie quesadilla was good.

Terrible service. Seriously waited over 40 minutes for our food to come. It's a shame because the food is good too. I wouldn't recommend if your wanting to eat. Especially on a Sunday morning. Amazing food though!

The definition of a great neighborhood joint!If you are looking for a no frills, relaxed, casual, consistently delicious place to hang out, O'nieals is the place for you.The place is relatively small and doubles in size once the weather is nice enough to open up the outdoor seating.  The bar seems bigger than the dining room, but don't let that throw you off.The best thing about the place is the food.When you read the menu, you think there's no possible way this could be good because there are so many different kinds of food.  From chicken fried steak, to shepherds pie, to crab cakes and penne ala vodka.  Seriously?  Could any one of these dishes be good?Whenever I see a menu like this in a pub, I picture a guy in the back somewhere with a dirty cutting board and microwave heating up things from the freezer.Shockingly, O'nieal's hits every dish out of the park.As a matter of fact, they don't even have a freezer!  Everything is fresh and made to order.We started with the fried mozzarella.  It is actual sliced mozzarella hand breaded and lightly fried over a perfect marinara sauce.  Absolutely delish!  I could have eaten 4 more orders of the stuff.I enjoyed it so much that I ordered fresh mozzarella on my burger.An entire page is dedicated to what they are most know for:  burgers.I went for the spivy burger which is their world famous patty with the addition of a nice fried egg on top.  When you cut into it, the egg is nice and runny, and makes the awesome bun soak up all the goodness.The hand cut fries are dynamite too.On the booze front...It is hard to find a good beer bar that carries a good amount of foreign imports, and also carries the standard domestic fare.Plenty of solid German, Belgian, and other European brews in bottle form, but you can still bring your Miller Light loving buddies here as well.For the ladies, there's an extensive martini list as well.

Hit here for Super Bowl Sunday brunch w/ my man, Blanco Jonny. We ate @ the bar.  I had eggs bene, Blanco had Irish breakfast.  Mine was good, Blanco loved his.  Guinness was fresh & tasty.  Bartender, Christine, was great & took care of us.After Brunch, some friends joined us & we continued to have a good time.  Staff was friendly & took care of us.While there I realized that they have been there for 27 yrs & I was going there back then, good to see its still around.  Peeps there were great, unlike some other 'Broken places.NY Giants Super Bowl XLVI Champions!

Let me say that I really want to like this place and other reviews are great, but I will not rave.  It is okay.  The service is usually great.  Nice hostess, servers and bartenders.  Food sounds delish and I love the options.  They cook to order, but always get it wrong.  I asked for my burger to be medium and it came out with a bun soaked in blood.  Literally dripping when I picked it up.  And it wasn't prepared how the menu stated.  Regardless, the flavor is great and you can tell the food is fresh.  Just hard for me to continue to risk the meal not living up to the standards when there are hundreds of restaurants in the area.  I still say, give it a shot.  Just be prepared to talk to the server if you aren't happy.
Amazing place. Great service, excellent staff, incredible atmosphere, amazing food. Best bar/restaurant in hoboken! The Pasta picante may be the best pasta dish in hoboken.
Cajun chicken sandwich came in very hard bread with a slender chicken cutlet and a rather aged tomato.  Service was very pleasant and helpful.  Kids chicken tenders were over fried and sad.
This place does brunch so well. The best bloody Mary's and burgers. I love the bacon infused vodka and the "make your own" aspect of the Bloody Marys. They also have a huge burger selection. Love it!

My favorite bar in Hoboken!  I've gotten to know the staff over the years.  Some have come and gone, others have stayed for a while.  The food is always good.  The Oneials club is pretty legit.  The burgers are yummy and the free wings on Sunday and Monday rock (NFL Season Only).There is dining in the bar area as well as in the back, where you will find a darkish room with 2 windows that overlook Church Square Park.Service is professional and the prices are just right.  Very hip and personable spot.  Check it out if you're in the hood!
My salad was awesome but my boyfriends sandwich was only eh. There are a few small tables but we sat at the bar. Not a bad atmosphere and service was good!
We picked this place based on generally good reviews. Not impressed. Thought it was 'average' at best. Staff was friendly though. And the ladies room door opens right into the dining area!
Love the burgers!!!!And all the food here :) Bar is super tiny but nice. Good date spot.

the staff was very friendly...lucky enough we found a table on a saturday night without a reservation.the bar tender suggested the first drink on their cocktail menu....not happening for me...the IPA on the tap was good...nutty...bold nd grassyMy burger was cooked well but the chicken in the pasta felt a little over cooked nd tough

This is a 5 star review for the burgers, a 5 star review for the bar service, and 2 starts for table service.  I guess that makes it 4 solid stars.  I really want everyone who is reading this to understand that this is one of the best burgers in the tri-state area.  GREAT burger.

I stumbled on this spot by accident one afternoon, and I'm glad I did!I had the Rajun Cajun burger at the suggestion of the very friendly bartender.  The burger took a little longer than I'm used to, but it was cooked a perfect medium-rare.  SO many places overcook their burgers.  Not Onieals.  This is by far the best burger in town and possibly the northeast.  Definitely worth an extra five minutes of your day if that's what it takes for them to get it right in the kitchen.  They have an unexpectedly good beer selection, so I tried one of their seasonal draughts, which the bartender told me was from a local brewery right here in New Jersey.  Very cool.I'm giving this place a fifth star based on the music selection and the friendliness of the bartender.  She was DJing from their iTunes playlist, and her mix was the perfect blend of classic rock, 80's and 90's throwbacks, and top-40 pop.  She even played a few Phish songs, which was dope, to say the least.Delicious food, nice staff, and very chill atmosphere.  What more can you ask for in your neighborhood tavern?  Way to go, Onieals.  I'll be back with phriends.

I don't see the appeal of this place as a restaurant, I think I must be missing something. One of my friend's raves about the veggie burger there, so maybe that's worth getting but everything I've tried there I was not impressed with.My favorite aspect of this place is that the outdoor seating is right next to the park so it's a great place to enjoy a drink and people watch but if you're looking for a good meal there's better options.

I've been coming to O'nieals for years and it's always awesome. Best burgers around. Brunch is a bit pricey for what you're getting, but is great food. O'nieals gets packed easily (it's not huge) so make sure to plan accordingly. Outside seating is great and they are dog friendly for these tables.

My boyfriend and I lived in a horrible, overpriced, hurricane damaged apartment in Hoboken for almost a year, and Onieals was one of the few and far between things that made that long dark 10 months bearable! The place is a tried and true down-to-earth neighborhood bar with a solid, non-pretentious menu and a staff that's friendly, fun, and on point. There's a nice selection of wines and draft beers, cool photography in the dining room, and a great outdoor seating area where the servers will ask if they can bring water and treats for your dog. The brunch is the bomb, as is the 3 B's (Blackened, Bacon, Bleu) burger. The pup and I both love the fries. For a while I suffered an unhealthy addiction to their blackened chicken sandwich, which always needed to be accompanied by an extra side of guac and a pint of Allagash White. Also, the music is good. Also, I heart that big ol' tree outside with the white Christmas lights. Keep doin' what you're doin' you guys! We will miss you!
Had lunch here back in October. Sat on the patio. Food was amazing and the service was extremely good. Had the nachos and a burger. Will be coming back for more.
Whitney was awesome at slinging drinks. Will be back.
Amazing burgers and drinks!!! The "John Wayne" burger...drooool.

You couldn't ask for a more classic American barroom and restaurant. There is a nice atmosphere, punctuated by very friendly and professional staff. The way it sits just off of the park makes it very comfortable for people watching. No wonder people always point out when a place is a "corner bar." There is something about the feng-shui or whatever it might be called.Don't be made to think that there is just great beer and food to be had here, either. The burgers ARE classic and the beers selection is well thought out, to be sure.Yet, for a smaller wine list than you'd find at more expensive spots, there is definitely some attention paid to making the quality shine through on the selections on the list. There are some real gems on the list.Great spot in Hoboken
Good variety of burgers and beer.  Outdoor seating during the warmer months is definitely a plus.

The food is acceptable. The staff should be retrained in professionalism. I was disgusted by some backhanded comments made toward a family with a child walking around, and towards a few of my guests, asking about reservations and drink specials. Service is important to me, which is why I will not be returning to this location.

One of a kind spot in Hoboken. While I love the outdoor seating, the friendly service, the beer selection, and the fact that my canine companion is as welcome as I am, my review is mainly for the Garden Burger Philly. I just can't get enough. Replace the fries with a side salad to try the basil vinaigrette and you have yourself a perfect meal :)

Great beer list, wonderful burgers, best in Hoboken. Also nice entrées and desserts if it's date night. Music is usually decent, as is the service. Great bar and outdoor seating if the weather is warm.
This is the best burger this side of the Hudson (that we have found thus far anyway) brunch is great also

They have such amazing food, their French Onion soup is great, their burgers are on point, and their deserts are scrumptious! However, their service needs improvement. Last night, our meal spanned over two hours for two French Onion soups, a salad, and the baja chicken entree. This place is always packed so if you're stretched for time, I'd suggest other places to dine.
Fantastic burgers. Can be a little crowded and uncomfortable at times but that's due to the high quality. Good problem to have I guess. Burgers are worth it.

My boyfriend and I have gone here at least a dozen times in the past year and this place has yet to disappoint. We love to go here for brunch (highly recommend the Irish Breakfast) and the food and service are always on point. For Hoboken this place has the BEST pub food around and friendly consistent service. The bar staff is what helps make the place a notch above the rest. You can go anywhere for food...you come back for the service and atmosphere.  We'll be back again and again.

Oniels, I hate to do this to you more than you hate to see it done. Things started off seemingly well, late lunch outdoors on a beautiful May Friday but alas, dark forces were at work. The waitress would barely check on us and much time passed before seeing her again. This was at 2pm and the place was empty. It took an hour and a half to get thru a chicken sandwich and a beer. That was my mistake - chicken sandwich was a terribly plain choice; the fries were good. Closing out the bill was another nightmare altogether. It took 15 mins to get it and another 20 to track her down for messing up the check split (charged each card the whole amount). Since I didn't factor this extra wasted time in, I was punished with a parking ticket from HPA. I won't be back.

Pleasantly surprised - you walk in and they have cool bar and restaurant atmosphere. Flipping through the menu, it's seemed like a step up from regular bar fare, but even a couple straight-forward meals like pesto chicken, steak sandwich (w/ Filet) and steak frites were really, really good. Even their chicken soup was awesome.I'd go back and explore more of the menu.

One of my favorite bars in Hoboken.  They have a lot of great beers on tap, wine specials during the week, and the food is very good.There are also plently of TVs at the bar, the occasional acoustic act, outdoor dining and a quiet dining room in the back.
Great food! Had the burger and it was delish! Would definitely recommend.

Went here for the parade. $20 cover. They had some live music a big crowd, and good staff. I am not a hoboken regular and have a hard time with the 6$ beers. They do have a great selection though. They have chimay on draught, a great bottle selection, and I hear that they have good food. This place is a little off the beaten path, but that actually makes it a little better to me. One of the cool things they have there is a wooden bench going across the whole long wall. Very useful. I did cut my finger on an exposed nail though. ouch. One odder things they do there is shots. They use these small plastic shot glasses and then fill them halfway. I understand a shot is a shot and you are getting the correct amount, but the size of the glass makes is very deceiving. Not terrible, just odd.

Gotta love Oniels! It's a great bar, slightly off the beaten path, but totally worth a visit.I've been there twice now for college football Saturdays and I will freely admit that I was there for hours. The crowd is great, but if you wear maize & blue (i.e. blue and gold, i.e. U of M colors) you'd better be prepared to be run out like a skinny kid at fat camp. Much to my chagrin, this place is an Ohio State bar.  On weekends where games can only be seen on the Big 10 Network, this place is packed with red and white wearing Ohio State fans. However, I have to give them major props for being decent and respectable fans. The whole place is great. The bartenders are friendly and remember your name - even if you've only been there once before. The fries are great and the brunch specials on game day are solid. I love hanging out here. As they say, time flies when you're having fun!

Came here just after noon for lunch.  Received a menu after about 5 minutes then sat for 15 minutes.. no service, no water, no anything.  The restaurant was practically empty too.  I guess filling up condiment containers is more important than serving the customers who have been sitting for 20 minutes.Maybe the food is good but I wouldn't know because the service sucks and we left.
The burgers here are fantastic.  Served on brioche roll.  Thick cut.  Great hand cut fries.  It's also a great place for Sunday brunch.

One of our absolute favorites in Hoboken!  We used to live right around the corner from Onieals and went about once a month.  It was also always a place we would take out of town guests because the food is excellent and the ambiance is funky and fun yet quiet enough to hear yourselves.  They serve fresh bread to start with oil and freshly saved parmesan which is delicious, but save plenty of room for dinner!  My husband LOVES the chicken montrachet and claims it is one of his favorite meals of all time.  I used to always order the eggplant parm but then it was taken off the menu! (That's my reason for only 4 stars - I have an agenda that I'm pushing, Onieals!)  There is also a great beer and wine list here.  You must go!

No matter what is going on outside in the world, life is good at Onieals.  I've come here for brunch/lunch, dinner, and just drinks and it has never disappointed.  Sometimes it's a little busy to chill out, but even then it's a good time.  The brunch cocktails are good, their food is way above average in a town of B+ dining, and the beer list is respectable (almost always has DFH 90-minute on tap).  I especially like their burgers and fries.  Go here. You won't regret it.

A. Small bar area, but chillB. Small outdoor area but good view of the park (when it gets warmer of course)C. Drinks were drinkableD. Food was edibleE. Prices were right in the range that you'd expect a bar to beF. Good enough spot to meet for a 1st date (ahem)G. Bartender was pretty cool and attentiveH. Feels like homeI will hit again.

Best burger in Hoboken (John Wayne is my favorite). Place is about quality, as just about everything on the menu will not disappoint. Nice low key atmosphere - 5 dollar wines on Wednesday are a good deal. Solid selection of beers on tap.

Yummy fish tacos with white wine satisfied my Tuesday night dinner. A friend had the house salad with grilled chicken and mentioned its tasty tossing. Sit outside or hang at the bar, either is a nice way to have a weekday dinner.

Awesome place to grab a craft beer and watch the game with your friends.  I'm not from the area but hope that when I am back we try this place again.  My friend that lives in the area is a regular here and the staff treated her and all of the other patrons wonderfully!  Looking forward to going back!

This place sucks. Twice in a row now they've taken a really long time to seat us (longer than they said) and bring out our food. Waitress tried to tell me it had ONLY been a half hour, when in fact it was actually over 45 minutes. Burger was burnt BOTH times, and not cooked "medium", but well done. They even managed to burn my girlfriend's veggie burger. Drinks were also overly expensive. Wouldn't go back.
The food here is fantastic! It's a small place, so you may have to wait for a table if it's crowded. It's worth it!

A friend that I hadn't seen in 17 years and I stopped in for a little reunion a few weeks ago. You've got my number on Irish bars with bar food. OK, I'm not a real girly girl most of the time but I'm not quite the burping type either!We both ordered burgers and both were very good. Done just the way we asked for them! They have a good variety of beers and the staff was very friendly and attentive. I really enjoyed this place and have to wonder what it's like in the evenings. Looks like I'll need to make another trip to Hoboken soon!

Excellent place for an evening rendezvous in Hoboken.  Gorgeous sitting by the park (if you sit outside) and even cozier, if you choose not to.  Friendliest waitresses, who listen and make great suggestions.  Proper good burger with delicious complimentary bread basket.We ordered a burger and pasta - delicious, al dente and perfectly flavored.  The dessert suggestion was fantastic as well.  As was the peach sangria and the mojito.Great, overall.

We decided to do brunch a couple weeks ago and opted to go with Onieals. This is a Hoboken standard which everyone should at least enjoy for a Beer and a Burger. We unfortunately waited quite a bit for service ... now I get it, I am a server at not one but two restaurants and I know how it can be. It doesn't make it any better though ... She turned out to be quite nice and prompt the rest of the way. I opted to go with the Eggs Sardeaux and the FIC went with the burger ... both were right on, but nothing that I was doing flips over. This is not to say that I won't be returning, we will but maybe it just wasn't their day. We will be back!

I booked a reservation here for Mother's Day and I must say we very much enjoyed our experience at this reasonably priced joint. Very kind and courteous wait staff, willing to go above and beyond. We were 15min late but they had a table already set up for us when we got there. The outdoor table was not to our liking because the air conditioner blew water on it at times, but they happily relocated us to a different outdoor table, no questions asked. The cocktails were strong and reasonably priced, and the food was expertly prepared. My mother had The Eggs Sardeux and I had the Church Square. Both were fantastic! I'll definitely be coming back.

A lively and friendly atmosphere in a cozy bar and restaurant.  Across the street is Church Square park, which offers a nice view when sitting indoors, or out on the patio during the warmer months.The menu offers a great selection of beer and fare from brunch to dinner.  The staff and atmosphere have been consistently wonderful.It is a comfortable place to just have a few drinks, watch a game, or just have a nice Sunday brunch.
Came in for lunch. Had their Famous Sloppy Joe. Loved their twist on it. The russian dressing really made it! Had a couple beers to cool down from this crazy hot weather. Enjoyed my time here =)

Nice bar with pretty good food.  Very extensive menu with a lot of options from typical bar food (wings, nachos, burgers, sandwiches) to a little bit better withsalads, pasta dishes, steaks and seafood. The folks who work their are really friendly and the atmosphere is casual and comfortable.  The dining room is pretty small and it tends to get busy after 7:30, so go earlier if you don't want a wait.It's right next to Church Street Park so it's a great  spot in the summer time for alfresco dining and drinking.

One of my fave resto/bars in the Boconos. Quality burgers and sandwiches, and an outstanding brunch. Great bar / beer selection and only a couple of TV's, which is a nice change of pace. The decor has a classic pub feel without trying to hard. I get the cajun burger with chicken almost every time... also try the eggs sardoux for brunch.

Good neighborhood gastropub.  Burgers and sandwiches are always reliable.  I've never had any of the entrees although my girlfriend has had some of the pastas and she enjoyed them.  Wed is half price wine night plus they know how to pour a proper Guiness!  Bartenders are super cool and they DJ with their ipods.  Sit outside when weather is nice.Only thing pulling this place back a star is that the live music is way too loud on the nights they have it, given the size of this place. Also, they really pack them in so it gets way crowded on Thurs-Sun late nights.  All in all this place is better as a casual meal and drinks spot than nightspot, but still one of my favorite neighborhood places in Hoboken.

WARNING: This review might be more of a story than a review. Read for your own enjoyment! This week, tragedy struck my apartment. I live with four guys, and more often than not, things get carried away and stuff gets broken. Recently, one of my larger and less graceful roommates (let's call him Moe Mullivan) spilled (and by spilled I mean dumped) a glass of water all over our cable box. While Moe claims it was an accident, the malicious intent I could see in his eyes lead me to believe otherwise. This heinous attack left our apartment separated from the world, which was probably his plan all along. In order rectify the situation, we had to trek into the depths of Hoboken to the optimum online office to replace the busted box. Because it was such a difficult journey, I decided to have a rest stop at Onieals to rest up and recharge. Located across the street from scenic Church Square on the corner of 4th and Park, this restaurant/bar is pretty unassuming without any large or flashy signs on the outside. The interior atmosphere is as relaxed as the exterior, which lends Onieals to be a nice meet up spot. They have a moderately sized bar area and a separate seating area with about 10 tables. Because it is off the main street, there wasn't much of a lunch crowd, which let my guests and I converse comfortably. However, with such a small crowd, I expected the service to be better than it was, but then again, I suppose it added to the relaxed atmosphere. Onieals offers your typical bar food, sandwiches, burgers, etc, but with a larger selection. At about $10 an entrée, I sampled their World Famous Burger, a sandwich, and a vegetarian sandwich between my guests and me. I will reserve me personal feelings for establishments calling their dishes world famous (seriously, who gets to decide that), but their burger was pretty good. It came with all the usual fixings like lettuce, onions, and tomatoes, and a side of fries. The burger was cooked a perfect medium and the meal left me feeling satisfied. My guest had the Church Square Sandwich which was a turkey, guacamole, and Monterey Jack cheese sandwich served with a side of fries. My other guest had the Foccacia Club which was an open faced sandwich that has a variety of grilled vegetables topped with melted mozzarella cheese served with a side of chips. Both felt that the sandwiches were better than your average bar food, which I can certainly agree with. Too many times I lower my standards for bar food because usually you either get a good bar, a good restaurant, or neither. However, Onieals shows me I don't have to settle because bars can make delicious food if they want to. I haven't decided whether I should be thankful that Moe forced us on the Cablevision journey but I did learn two important lessons. First, keep your liquids and electronics separate, and second, never let go of your standards. If only I could get Moe to learn the same lessons and keep him from watching his True Blood and Tool Academy. The Bottom Line: Onieals raises the bar for food. So if you are looking for a bite to eat and a bit to drink, then consider walking down and trying them out.

This place is just a great low-key, chill neighborhood bar.  The waitresses and bartenders are always super friendly.  When it is warm outside, the outdoor seating is very key, especially with the year-round christmas lights hung around the trees outside.Everything on the menu has been consistently good.  Burgers are absolutely great (altho, I personally like Zack's better), but you get a fun mix of different burger types with different toppings (like a pizza).  Perfectly big, juicy, and flavorful on a sesame bun.  Sandwiches are great too - I love the meatball sandwich.  Pasta dishes are good too, especially the chicken parmesan and spaghetti and meatballs are really tasty..The bar area gets packed very quickly for dinner.  There is dining room seating in the back, but I like to eat at our around the bar - or outside.

If you like waiting over an hour for your brunch, then this place is for you. The service is awful and the food is definitely not worth the ridiculously long wait.  I can say with certainty that I won't be going  back.  I'll stick with the eggs florentine at Elysian.

Definitely good burgers. Somewhat loud environment with good food. Great service in An old style wood covered pub. Only one odd thing... The soft drink glasses are unusually tall and skinny which makes them prone to tipping over.

Beer selection is OK, service is generally OK, wine is good, appetizers are good, Food is good but slightly overpriced.Last time I was there we had a friend meet us at a table for two. When I asked the waiter if we could bring up an extra chair, he said "No." Then we walked behind the divider and I started bad mouthing him and the service and we immediately got re-seated in the bar area with a third seat. The fact that he said no rubbed me the wrong way, but everyone else was nice.
Overpriced for the quality of meats and seafood but generally tasty. Sunday brunch is popular. Friendly waitstaff was a plus. Tables are tiny. Bloody Mary menu is amazing.

A go-to neighborhood place. Great veggie burger - can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches, actually. I don't go here late night, but I love the laid-back atmosphere at a weekday dinner or weekend lunch. Get a table outside so you can do some dog (or people) watching.

Sat outside on a nice night in late August. Relaxing atmosphere despite the cover band inside (man, I'm getting old). It was late, so the gf and I just had a couple drinks and appetizers. Food was really tasty -- fried calamari (my fav) and homemade pita + hummus -- but my Jack and ginger was pretty weak. Will prob stick to the microbrew list next time around.  Gf enjoyed the cucumber martini, said she'd order it again.

A friend and I stopped in for lunch and I was pleasantly surprised.  Had a great hamburger here and would definitely go back if I'm in the area.  The outside patio was full up, as it was a beautiful day, so we sat inside instead.  The atmosphere is totally casual and comfortable.  Thumbs up!

Great place to grab a nice burger. Come here when it's nice outside so you can enjoy their amazing brunch outdoors. The realtors here like to bring their clients for lunch/ early dinner. We recommend the mozzarella appetizer!

I really have enjoyed Onieals over the years living in Hoboken. It's across the street from the park so we go there with our now 3 year old son. They are always very accomdating and relatively quick (we do go early so there isn't a huge crowd). Food and beer is good. It's on of our "go to" places in Hoboken. Prices seem reasonable as well.

Absolutely my favorite restaurant in all of New Jersey.  The atmosphere, the food, the drinks, the staff are absolutely perfect.  And in my 43 years I have never had such good French Onion soup in my life.

Onieal's was my go-to place when I lived in Hoboken, as it is one of the best restaurants in town.  I first began eating here in the early 90's when I lived around the way.  I ate here at least once a week as a resident, but when I moved into Manhattan I only ate here occasionally.The food is consistently good, the ambiance is warm and inviting, and the menu has a decent variety of items from which to choose.  I definitely recommend you give it a try.   It's highly conducive to good conversation if there is no live music playing.

I went here last night with a girlfriend for dinner and drinks. We were very impressed with the food. The best part was wine by the glass on Wednesdays is $5! They have a pretty good selection to top it off! I ordered the spaghetti bolognese, it was actually amazing! The portion was huge not to mentiom it was extremely flavorful and overall delicious. I definitely recommend this spot for a romantic dinner or intimate setting.. not such a great spot for large groups since the dining area is small. The service was also pretty good.

I avoided this place for awhile solely because the number of vowels in its name drove me crazy. Is it O'Niels? O'Neals? O'Nieals? Argh!I was glad I got over it, though. The menu here is huge and both times I've dined here I was really happy with my meal. Their veggie burger is made in-house, and all of their burgers can be subbed for the veggie version. Fries are awesome, too. Service in the dining room was very good last time I was here. Even though we were the only ones inside and it was a bit late, the server was really friendly and we weren't rushed at all. The dining room is also decorated stylishly, kind of an Old Hollywood vibe. On the other hand, once when I ate at the bar I was a little put-off. Our bartender finished her shift just after our meals were served. She then sat down beside us with a friend to drink and eat dinner. I still tipped 20%, and understand they probably pool, but I felt a little weird tipping someone who was sitting right next to me like a regular customer. Based on the food, I'll definitely come back to O'Nieaieaieaieal's!
Great for brunch - eggs sardeaux and eggs benedict, plus burger menu, are on point. Also great drink menu.
Super friendly, neighborly service.  Crayons for doodling.  Vegetarian options are pretty slim on the lunch/brunch menu.  But what was available was very good.
Average Pub. Lots of TVs for such a small space.

Went here for a late lunch one Sunday afternoon with a friend.  The first thing that caught our attention was the menu.  Seated in the dining room, in a room to the side of the bar, we debated for quite a while over what to get; everything looked so good.Ultimately, I got the monte cristo sandwich, which was decent.  The fries were tasty - nice and hot.The relaxed atmosphere and fair food made for an enjoyable lunch with a friend.  Although I'd go to Onieals again, I can't say it'd be my first choice.

The location and food are actually really great. The service is consistently awful. They are fairly attentive but no one there should be in the customer service business - they all seem resentful to be there. The Friday daytime bartender/waiter is particularly just downright mean. I don't think he uttered one word to us the entire time we were there - more like grunted.

One of my favorites. My father came down for a late lunch/early dinner on Sunday. While I try to take him somewhere new every time he comes down, we often find ourselves here if he wants a burger, few beers and not a lot of loud and obnoxious people at the bar for a Sunday Funday. O'nieals always seems to be my go to when he wants something quick, easy and in the neighborhood or for myself if just want to grab a drink or two and something to eat after a late night at work, not in the mood to cook etc., I always suggest the fried mozzarella and a burger. They have a great selection of draft and bottled beers, however I'm impartial as they have Warwick Winery's' Doc Cider which I typically go in for. Warm atmosphere, great bar staff and regulars are all chill. I consider this one of the secret bars of Hoboken. It's far enough off Washington and in midtown versus down near 1st and Newark that visitors don't typically tend to be here. I personally think it's a great date spot or place to go after going out to dinner and just want a drink or two.
Came here for saturday brunch and the food was excellent and inexpensive and the service was great.  Good coffee too.  I had the french toast which was great.  Will definitely keep coming back here.

Very relaxed, friendly atmosphere with great staff.  Everything I've had has been fantastic except the Steak Fried Chicken... which was... well... it's Steak Fried Chicken, I don't know what I expected.  The house salad is also delicious, as are the burgers and... everything but the Steak Fried Chicken.  A great place for drinks or a meal, and perhaps the most comfortable outdoor seating in Hoboken short of something on the waterfront.

Go here for dinner and lunch as it is on the same block as I live.  The service is very friendly.  Food is good for a quick fix too.  Great place to get together with friends in laid back environment and to put back a few.
